page.title: 03LOSSIEMOUTH HARBOUR.
page.content: Lossiemouth harbour is situated to the east of the area and construction was begun in 1837.At the beginning of the century there were 160 fishing boats in the Lossiemouth fleet.Now in 1985 there are only 15 boats fishing regularly from the port because most of these have moved to better fishing- grounds on the east and west coasts The local boats land some white fish.These are sold at the fish-market which is held between 8a.m.and 10a.m. daily.The prawns are bought locally by the Fish-Processing Plant.Fifty stone of prawns are purchased daily for the Plant.The white fish is bought by local fish merchants for sale over the counter.The fishing boats land approximately 250 boxes in total between them.
